title: Chapecoense 'Angel Boy' Attended Real Madrid Training And Met His Idols
text:
Chapecoense 'Angel Boy' Attended Real Madrid Training And Met His Idols Tue Feb 21 2017 14:12:21 GMT+0000 (GMT) Tue Feb 21 2017 14:12:21 GMT+0000 (GMT) Josh Lawless Josh Lawless in football 
Young Johan Alexis Ramirez made headlines when he provided assistance to the rescue teams and helped them find the aircraft following the devastating LaMia Flight 2933 plane crash in late November in which 71 of the 77 passengers on the flight to Medellin, Colombia sadly lost their lives. 
Only one of the four crewmembers, three Chapecoense players, and two other passengers survived. 
However it could have been even worse if it wasn't for Johan Ramirez, who displayed incredible bravery and directed the rescue team to where the plane had crashed. 
The youngster was rewarded for his help with a life-changing gift for his family as the run-down house they were living in was upgraded. 
You can see the transformation here: 
Credit: Youtube/Compasion Fundacion 
And it got even better for the heroic Johan, a staunch Real Madrid fan, as he was invited to the club's training facility and prior to training, had the opportunity to meet manager Zinedine Zidane as well as have his picture taken with a number of his heroes. 
Courtesy of Real Madrid's official website, here are some images of Johan with the Champions League and Club World Cup winners: 
Johan also received a signed Real Madrid shirt from his fellow Colombian James Rodriguez, in what was a brilliant gesture. 
Real released a brilliant behind-the-scenes video of Johan's day at Real Madrid City and what a day he had! 
Credit: Real Madrid CF 
Johan was also in attendance to see his beloved Los Blancos beat Espanyol 2-0 at the Bernabeu at the weekend. Johan Alexis Ramírez who helped guide rescue teams to the Chapecoense plane crash was also invited to the Bernabeu for the Espanyol game :slight_smile: pic.twitter.com/dZdUdd7GM9 - M•A•J (@U1traSuristic) February 20, 2017 
It's fantastic to see Real well and truly spoil the 15-year old and give him an experience he will never forget. After his heroics in helping save six lives in the Chapecoense plane crash, it's incredibly heartwarming to see him up close and personal with the individuals who he looks up to so much. 
Speaking to the Real Madrid website about the signed shirt he was given by James Rodriguez, he said: 
"James represents all Colombians. It's very emotional and something very nice for me. This shirt is a very nice gift that I will have for a lifetime, it's a pleasure for me. 
A wonderful story for the young man quite rightly dubbed 'Angel Boy'. Sponsored Links
